thread.title: Sri Lanka drought: India to donate eight water bowsers, 100 tonnes of rice
thread.title_full: Sri Lanka drought: India to donate eight water bowsers, 100 tonnes of rice

author: ANI
title: Sri Lanka drought: India to donate eight water bowsers, 100 tonnes of rice
text:
Sri Lanka drought: India to donate eight water bowsers, 100 tonnes of rice Sri Lanka drought: India to donate eight water bowsers, 100 tonnes of rice Foreign Secretary of India S Jaishankar, visited Sri Lanka from February 18 to 20, for bilateral discussions with their leaders, as part of the continued high level engagement between the two countries. By: ANI | New Delhi | Updated: February 21, 2017 10:11 AM Foreign Secretary of India S Jaishankar called on Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. (Reuters) 
Foreign Secretary of India S Jaishankar, visited Sri Lanka from February 18 to 20, for bilateral discussions with their leaders, as part of the continued high level engagement between the two countries. During his visit, Jaishankar called on Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. The Foreign Secretary reviewed the entire gamut of our bilateral relations, particularly Indian assisted economic projects and development particularly with Sri Lanka. 
You may also like to watch: 
In response to the drought situation in Sri Lanka, Jaishankar conveyed on behalf of Minister of External Affairs Sushma Swaraj to Minister of Foreign Affairs Mangala Samaraweera, that India would donate eight water bowsers and 100 metric tonnes of rice as immediate assistance, and was ready to provide further assistance as required.
